Unique solution theorem of ODE

A ODE

has an unique solution in C1C^1C1﻿ if and only if both of following hold

  1. fff﻿ is continuous differentiable at given time interval t∈It\in It∈I﻿
  1. fff﻿ is Lipschitz-continuous at given interval: there exist a L>0L>0L>0﻿ such that

interpretation: you can always a finite maximum slope value LLL﻿ in given interval if the function is continuous. counterexample: in jumping discontinuity, the maximum slope is positive infinity so it is not finite
